discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: The name `ConsensusBasedOptimization` seems like it should be okay for this. A short, non-common acronym like `CBX` isn't going to work, I'm afraid. Not even with an existing [CBXpy](https://github.com/PdIPS/CBXpy) package. You might still be able to use the "CBX" branding by having `CBX` be a submodule of `ConsensusBasedOptimization` so that the package can be loaded as `using ConsensusBasedOptimization: CBX`, or something like that.
